intro: Ruellia loefgrenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically features opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
